intro: Mazus miquelii f. albiflorus, commonly known as the white-flowered mazus, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, sprawling habit. The plant features small, hairy leaves and produces clusters of white or pale blue flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers sunny to partially shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
